original: Dalen, Anders Gustaf Bertil, läroverksadjunkt, Växjö, f. 13/9/88 i Ask-landa, Älvsb. 1., av kommin. emer. A. P. D. o. Emma Moberger. G. 15 m. Ragnhild Åkermark. Barn: Vaino f. 16, Ingrid 19, Åke 21. — Stud:ex. i Skara 05, fil. mag. i Upps. 10, fil. lic. 13. Resa t. Tyskl. 14. Vik. adj. i Varberg 12, förste lär. i Kiruna 13-20, e. o. lektor i Uddevalla 20-22, ord. adj. i matem., fysik o. kemi i Växjö sed. 21. Skolöverstyr. omb. v. realex. i Strömsnäsbruk 24-25, dito i Örkel-Ijunga 24, i Ljungby 25-27 o. i Osby 44, 45 o. 46, led. av ex:nd v. realex. i Malmö 45 o. 46. RVO 44.
translated: Dalen, Anders Gustaf Bertil was a high school teacher in Växjö. He was born on September 13th, 1888 in Asklanda, Älvsborg County, the first child of the retired minister A.P.D. and Emma Moberger. He married Ragnhild Åkermark in 1915, and they had three children: Vaino, born in 1916, Ingrid in 1919, and Åke in 1921. He received his studentexamen (Swedish high school diploma) in Skara in 1905, a Bachelor of Arts degree in Uppsala in 1910, and a Licentiate of Philosophy degree in 1913. In 1914, he traveled to Germany. He worked as a temporary teacher in Varberg in 1912, as a first teacher in Kiruna from 1913 to 1920, as a substitute lecturer in Uddevalla from 1920 to 1922, and as a permanent lecturer in mathematics, physics, and chemistry in Växjö starting in 1921. He was appointed headmaster of the lower-secondary school in Strömsnäsbruk from 1924 to 1925, headmaster of schools in Örkelljunga in 1924, in Ljungby from 1925 to 1927, and in Osby in 1944, 1945, and 1946. He was also a member of the examination board for the lower-secondary school in Malmö in 1945 and 1946 and was awarded the Order of the Polar Star in 1944.
